title: 107_s2428
content: The Act titled "National Sea Grant College Program Act Amendments of 2002" amends findings related to the National Sea Grant College Program, emphasizing collaborations between Administration scientists and scientists at academic institutions. The National Sea Grant College Program Act Amendments of 2002 emphasize the development of a quadrennial strategic plan and the allocation of funding to encourage coordination and cooperation between research entities. The National Sea Grant College Program Act Amendments of 2002 emphasize coordination and cooperation between research, education, and outreach programs, as well as ensuring equal access for minority and economically disadvantaged students. The terms of membership for the Sea Grant Review Panel have been amended to specify a 3-year term for members appointed before 2002 and a 4-year term for members appointed or reappointed after 2002, with the possibility of a 1-year extension. Authorization of appropriations is also addressed. The National Sea Grant College Program Act is amended to authorize appropriations of $75,000,000 for fiscal year 2004, increasing to $85,000,000 for fiscal year 2008. Additionally, $5,000,000 is authorized for competitive grants for university research on biology and control of zebra. The National Sea Grant College Program Act authorizes appropriations for university research on non-native species, oyster diseases, harmful algal blooms, and fisheries extension programs. The National Sea Grant College Program Act limits the use of funds for administration and prohibits the use of funds for other offices or programs. Excess appropriations are to be distributed to State sea grant programs and national strategic initiatives on a competitive basis.
